decision_conditions: The amendment to Condition 16 of planning permission 19/00582/FUL is considered to be non-material and as such falls within the scope of Section 96a of the Town and Country Planning act 1990 (as amended).Condition 16 shall be reworded as follows:Original ConditionPrior to occupancy of the development a BREEAM post construction review should be carried out within 1 year of construction of the development and a Final BREEAM Excellent certificate should be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The post construction review and certificate will ensure that the best endeavours of the developer have been made to ensure the development has fully complied with the requirements of the BREEAM Very Good standard.Revised wordingA BREEAM post construction review should be carried out within 1 year of construction of the development and a Final BREEAM Very Good certificate should be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The post construction review and certificate will ensure that the best endeavours of the developer have been made to ensure the development has fully complied with the requirements of the BREEAM Very Good standard.Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation as set out in Policies 5.2 (Minimising Carbon Dioxide Emissions) and 5.3 (Sustainable Design & Construction) of the London Plan (July 2011) and Policy DM1 (Sustainable Design and Construction Standards) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
description: Non-Material Amendment to Planning Permission ref: 19/00582/FUL (Demolition of existing buildings and erection of a new 80 bed, three-storey dementia nursing home (Use Class C2) with associated gardens, pedestrian and vehicle access, car parking and servicing area). Amendment relating to Breeam Certificate
